com.linecorp.armeria.client

Class SessionOption<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.util.AbstractConstant
      • com.linecorp.armeria.common.util.AbstractOption<T>
        • com.linecorp.armeria.client.SessionOption<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the option value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Constant, Comparable

    public final class SessionOption<T>
extends AbstractOption<T>
    An option that affects the session management of a ClientFactory.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SessionOption<AddressResolverGroup<? extends InetSocketAddress>> ADDRESS_RESOLVER_GROUP
      The AddressResolverGroup to use to resolve remote addresses into InetSocketAddresses.
      static SessionOption<Duration> CONNECT_TIMEOUT
      The timeout of a socket connection attempt.
      static SessionOption<EventLoopGroup> EVENT_LOOP_GROUP
      The EventLoopGroup that will provide the EventLoop for I/O and asynchronous invocations.
      static SessionOption<Duration> IDLE_TIMEOUT
      The idle timeout of a socket connection.
      static SessionOption<Function<KeyedChannelPoolHandler<PoolKey>,KeyedChannelPoolHandler<PoolKey>>> POOL_HANDLER_DECORATOR
      The Function that decorates the KeyedChannelPoolHandler.
      static SessionOption<Consumer<SslContextBuilder>> SSL_CONTEXT_CUSTOMIZER
      A Consumer which can arbitrarily configure the SslContextBuilder that will be applied to this session.
      static SessionOption<TrustManagerFactory> TRUST_MANAGER_FACTORY
      Deprecated. 
      Use SSL_CONTEXT_CUSTOMIZER instead.
      static SessionOption<Boolean> USE_HTTP1_PIPELINING
      Whether to use HTTP pipelining for HTTP/1 connections.
      static SessionOption<Boolean> USE_HTTP2_PREFACE
      Whether to send an HTTP/2 preface string instead of an HTTP/1 upgrade request to negotiate the protocol version of a cleartext HTTP connection.

      Creates a new value of this option.

    • Field Detail

      • CONNECT_TIMEOUT

        public static final SessionOption<Duration> CONNECT_TIMEOUT
        The timeout of a socket connection attempt.

      • IDLE_TIMEOUT

        public static final SessionOption<Duration> IDLE_TIMEOUT
        The idle timeout of a socket connection. The connection is closed if there is no invocation in progress for this amount of time.

      • TRUST_MANAGER_FACTORY

        @Deprecated
public static final SessionOption<TrustManagerFactory> TRUST_MANAGER_FACTORY
        Deprecated. Use SSL_CONTEXT_CUSTOMIZER instead.
        The TrustManagerFactory of a TLS connection.

      • SSL_CONTEXT_CUSTOMIZER

        public static final SessionOption<Consumer<SslContextBuilder>> SSL_CONTEXT_CUSTOMIZER
        A Consumer which can arbitrarily configure the SslContextBuilder that will be applied to this session. For example, use SslContextBuilder.trustManager(java.io.File) to configure a custom server CA or SslContextBuilder.keyManager(java.io.File, java.io.File) to configure a client certificate for SSL authorization.

      • ADDRESS_RESOLVER_GROUP

        public static final SessionOption<AddressResolverGroup<? extends InetSocketAddress>> ADDRESS_RESOLVER_GROUP
        The AddressResolverGroup to use to resolve remote addresses into InetSocketAddresses.

      • EVENT_LOOP_GROUP

        public static final SessionOption<EventLoopGroup> EVENT_LOOP_GROUP
        The EventLoopGroup that will provide the EventLoop for I/O and asynchronous invocations. If unspecified, a new one is created automatically.

      • POOL_HANDLER_DECORATOR

        public static final SessionOption<Function<KeyedChannelPoolHandler<PoolKey>,KeyedChannelPoolHandler<PoolKey>>> POOL_HANDLER_DECORATOR
        The Function that decorates the KeyedChannelPoolHandler.

      • USE_HTTP2_PREFACE

        public static final SessionOption<Boolean> USE_HTTP2_PREFACE
        Whether to send an HTTP/2 preface string instead of an HTTP/1 upgrade request to negotiate the protocol version of a cleartext HTTP connection.

      • USE_HTTP1_PIPELINING

        public static final SessionOption<Boolean> USE_HTTP1_PIPELINING
        Whether to use HTTP pipelining for HTTP/1 connections. This does not affect HTTP/2 connections. This option is enabled by default.

    • Method Detail

      • valueOf

        public static <T> SessionOption<T> valueOf(String name)
        Returns the SessionOption of the specified name.

      • newValue

        public SessionOptionValue<T> newValue(T value)
        Creates a new value of this option.
